intro: Senecio gallicus var. araneosus, commonly known as the woolly mouse-eared cichorium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in its native habitat.
